title: 11 Best Linen Sprays That Will Maximize Your Sleep Setup
description: Designing a multi-sensory sleep experience has never been easier
author: Blake Bakkila
excerpt: Designing a multi-sensory sleep experience has never been easier with the best linen sprays from Jo Malone, The Laundress, Byredo, and more.
text: After you’ve located the bedding of your dreams, the best linen sprays can bring your sleep set up to the next level. Their vessels are akin to upscale perfume bottles, but these do more than sit pretty on your nightstand or dresser. Soothing aromas can help you catch extra Zzzs and ease anxiety, too. Their versatility even extends outside the bedroom—a gentle spritz over your throw pillow collection or even into a dinner party napkin can be a warm welcome to guests. Since we've always been serious about your sleep, we took the liberty of matching each spray on this list with an AD-approved bedding pick (meaning all that's left is finding the perfect pillow or comforter). Read on to discover the best linen spray options to freshen your bedspread, wow overnight visitors, or even use to perk up your wardrobe staples pre-laundry day.Our Top Picks for the Best Linen Sprays:Best Modern Floral Linen Spray: Jo Malone Lavender & Moonflower Pillow Mist, $52Best Clean Laundry Scent: The Laundress Classic Fabric Spray, $19Best Relaxing Spray: OSEA Malibu Vagus Nerve Pillow Mist, $38Best Plant-Based Spray Koala Eco Pillow & Linen Spray, $15Best Coastal Italy-Inspired Scent: Capri Blue Volcano Room Spray, $28Jo Malone London Lavender & Moonflower Pillow MistClinical psychologist and clinical sleep specialist Michael Breus, Ph.D. previously told AD that lavender is a particularly solid choice for sleep, since it can cause a relaxation response in your muscles. Known for their unique fragrance profiles, Jo Malone combines lavender and moonflower in this pillow mist packaged in their signature silver-capped glass bottles.“This smells like your expensive aunt who shopped at Totokaelo pre-closure and ate at Bridges pre-NYT write-up,” says commerce editor Audrey Lee. “Lavendar can skew a little mature in some fragrances but the musky notes balances out what could easily be an overly floral scent in this fragrance.” This trendsetter likely spritzes it over her favorite Magniberg duvet cover that caught her eye at Lichen when she was picking out a bamboo room divider.Notes: ​​English lavender, moonflowers, and white muskThe Laundress Classic Fabric SprayIf you're already a fan of The Laundress’s high-end cleaning supplies, their fabric spray mimics the line’s clean, minimalist look. “This scent smells exactly like laundry day—minus having to sort your darks and whites,” says Lee, who described it as “clean but not sterile, with a hint of floral that sneaks up on your senses.” Use it on bedding—like this crisp, organic cotton Brooklinen sheet set—or clothing for a garden-fresh home fragrance (it’ll even smooth out wrinkles).Notes: Fresh, aldehydic, citrus, marine, lavender, rose, jasmine, lily of the valley, ylang-ylang, musk, oakmoss, patchouli, sandalwood, and cedarwoodL'Occitane Cocon de Sérénité Relaxing Pillow MistSpraying this pillow mist will transform your space into a personal spa. Some customer reviews even mentioned loving it so much that they purchased a spare bottle for their car. We’d match the brand’s French countryside vibes with this French flax linen sheet set from Bed Threads. The ‘Turmeric’ shade even evokes the brand’s signature color and senior digital editor Zoë Sessums once called the bedding “sturdy, beautiful, and perfect for temperature control.”Notes: Petitgrain, orange, roseDedCool Room + Linen Spray 01 "Taunt"Both a room and linen spray, Taunt is described as alluring and comforting, a powerful combination thanks to fresh top notes and warm bottom notes like vanilla. “Every element in Dedcool’s Taunt room spray works perfectly together in harmony. It’s got warmth and just a hint of sweetness,” says Lee. The petite glass bottle is 100% recyclable, but reviewers swear it’s three fluid ounces of pure bliss. We think it’d pair nicely with this Buffy striped number that’s got a classic vibe and a similarly well-balanced feel.Notes: Bergamot, cassis, vanilla and amberOSEA Vagus Nerve Pillow MistAromatherapy is one thing, but OSEA Malibu’s award-winning pillow mist specifically targets your vagus nerve to promote wellness. The blend of essential oils, including chamomile and lavender, will transform your bedroom into a serene oasis. Use this scalloped Serena & Lily set in a blue and white colorway to convert your bedroom into a calm, coastal oasis from smell to slumber.Notes: Chamomile, juniper berry, lavender, lemon tea tree, and Moroccan rosemaryMuse Apothecary Linen Ritual Soothing Linen SprayThe most budget-friendly pick, this under $10, essential oil-infused spray is backed by more than 5,000 five-star reviews on Amazon. There are several soothing scents, but fans are partial to sleep-inducing Lavender Serenity. For a match made in sleep heaven, opt for this dusty mauve sheet set from Quince, one of our go-tos for high-quality, affordable bedding.Notes: night-blooming jasmine, ylang-ylang, coconut milk, chamomile, French lavender, amber, patchouli, and rosewoodKoala Eco Pillow & Linen SprayOne study shared that eucalyptus had sedative powers for mice, so we have science-backed evidence that this candy cane-smelling spray will send you into dreamland. We also love how the bottle, which is made from 100% post-consumer recycled bottles, features illustrations of the key notes. As an homage to its prominent peppermint aroma, pair it with this candy cane-inspired set we found from Anthropologie.Notes: Eucalyptus, peppermint, and bush lavenderCapri Blue Volcano Room SpraySpeaking of, if you’ve ever walked into an Anthropologie, you’re well aware of the best-selling scent from Capri Blue. In room spray form, it’s just as intoxicating and sweet, and the bold blue and silver bottle is the ultimate accent for a coastal-inspired nightstand. We’d play up the striking bottle with this cobalt blue-trimmed Rebecca Udall bedding that’s simple but beautiful.Notes: Sugared citrus and tropical fruitsthisworks Deep Sleep Pillow SprayAnother Amazon favorite, this best-selling pillow spray employs stress-relieving, relaxing ingredients to help you sleep more soundly. If you need more support in that department, it’s one part of a collection of better sleep solutions. We think it’d be the perfect way to ensure any overnight guest gets a full eight hours. Pair it with this energetic floral print from Schoolhouse to create a home away from home they may never want to leave.Notes: Lavender, chamomile, and vetiverMaison Francis Kurkdjian Aqua Universalis Linen MistFrom the makers of the celeb-favorite Baccarat Rouge, this spray's olfactory palette consists of leathery musk juxtaposed with floral and citrus. For a scent Lee likened to “checking into a five-star hotel or shopping at a luxury boutique,” we’d choose these hotel-quality Frette sheets.Notes: Musk, bergamot, bouquet of fresh white flowers, and lemonByredo Toile Textile Perfume“I wasn't familiar with the Toile fragrance line prior to testing this product, but to me it smells soft and powdery,” says commerce director Rachel Fletcher. She noticed the aroma was “much more subtle” after it’s fully settled into the fabric with “a bit of floral that embodies an expensive hotel scent more than anything else.” She recommended misting it over this Piglet in a Bed gingham set for a night’s rest that feels as good as gold.Notes: Bergamot, aldehyde, lily of the valley, violet silk, cotton musk
html:
After you’ve located the bedding of your dreams, the best linen sprays can bring your sleep set up to the next level. Their vessels are akin to upscale perfume bottles, but these do more than sit pretty on your nightstand or dresser. Soothing aromas can help you catch extra Zzzs and ease anxiety, too. Their versatility even extends outside the bedroom—a gentle spritz over your throw pillow collection or even into a dinner party napkin can be a warm welcome to guests. Since we've always been serious about your sleep, we took the liberty of matching each spray on this list with an AD-approved bedding pick (meaning all that's left is finding the perfect pillow or comforter). Read on to discover the best linen spray options to freshen your bedspread, wow overnight visitors, or even use to perk up your wardrobe staples pre-laundry day.

Our Top Picks for the Best Linen Sprays:

  • Best Modern Floral Linen Spray: Jo Malone Lavender & Moonflower Pillow Mist, $52
  • Best Clean Laundry Scent: The Laundress Classic Fabric Spray, $19
  • Best Relaxing Spray: OSEA Malibu Vagus Nerve Pillow Mist, $38
  • Best Plant-Based Spray Koala Eco Pillow & Linen Spray, $15
  • Best Coastal Italy-Inspired Scent: Capri Blue Volcano Room Spray, $28

Jo Malone London Lavender & Moonflower Pillow Mist

Clinical psychologist and clinical sleep specialist Michael Breus, Ph.D. previously told AD that lavender is a particularly solid choice for sleep, since it can cause a relaxation response in your muscles. Known for their unique fragrance profiles, Jo Malone combines lavender and moonflower in this pillow mist packaged in their signature silver-capped glass bottles.

“This smells like your expensive aunt who shopped at Totokaelo pre-closure and ate at Bridges pre-NYT write-up,” says commerce editor Audrey Lee. “Lavendar can skew a little mature in some fragrances but the musky notes balances out what could easily be an overly floral scent in this fragrance.” This trendsetter likely spritzes it over her favorite Magniberg duvet cover that caught her eye at Lichen when she was picking out a bamboo room divider.

Notes: ​​English lavender, moonflowers, and white musk

The Laundress Classic Fabric Spray

If you're already a fan of The Laundress’s high-end cleaning supplies, their fabric spray mimics the line’s clean, minimalist look. “This scent smells exactly like laundry day—minus having to sort your darks and whites,” says Lee, who described it as “clean but not sterile, with a hint of floral that sneaks up on your senses.” Use it on bedding—like this crisp, organic cotton Brooklinen sheet set—or clothing for a garden-fresh home fragrance (it’ll even smooth out wrinkles).

Notes: Fresh, aldehydic, citrus, marine, lavender, rose, jasmine, lily of the valley, ylang-ylang, musk, oakmoss, patchouli, sandalwood, and cedarwood

L'Occitane Cocon de Sérénité Relaxing Pillow Mist

Spraying this pillow mist will transform your space into a personal spa. Some customer reviews even mentioned loving it so much that they purchased a spare bottle for their car. We’d match the brand’s French countryside vibes with this French flax linen sheet set from Bed Threads. The ‘Turmeric’ shade even evokes the brand’s signature color and senior digital editor Zoë Sessums once called the bedding “sturdy, beautiful, and perfect for temperature control.”

Notes: Petitgrain, orange, rose

DedCool Room + Linen Spray 01 "Taunt"

Both a room and linen spray, Taunt is described as alluring and comforting, a powerful combination thanks to fresh top notes and warm bottom notes like vanilla. “Every element in Dedcool’s Taunt room spray works perfectly together in harmony. It’s got warmth and just a hint of sweetness,” says Lee. The petite glass bottle is 100% recyclable, but reviewers swear it’s three fluid ounces of pure bliss. We think it’d pair nicely with this Buffy striped number that’s got a classic vibe and a similarly well-balanced feel.

Notes: Bergamot, cassis, vanilla and amber

OSEA Vagus Nerve Pillow Mist

Aromatherapy is one thing, but OSEA Malibu’s award-winning pillow mist specifically targets your vagus nerve to promote wellness. The blend of essential oils, including chamomile and lavender, will transform your bedroom into a serene oasis. Use this scalloped Serena & Lily set in a blue and white colorway to convert your bedroom into a calm, coastal oasis from smell to slumber.

Notes: Chamomile, juniper berry, lavender, lemon tea tree, and Moroccan rosemary

Muse Apothecary Linen Ritual Soothing Linen Spray

The most budget-friendly pick, this under $10, essential oil-infused spray is backed by more than 5,000 five-star reviews on Amazon. There are several soothing scents, but fans are partial to sleep-inducing Lavender Serenity. For a match made in sleep heaven, opt for this dusty mauve sheet set from Quince, one of our go-tos for high-quality, affordable bedding.

Notes: night-blooming jasmine, ylang-ylang, coconut milk, chamomile, French lavender, amber, patchouli, and rosewood

Koala Eco Pillow & Linen Spray

One study shared that eucalyptus had sedative powers for mice, so we have science-backed evidence that this candy cane-smelling spray will send you into dreamland. We also love how the bottle, which is made from 100% post-consumer recycled bottles, features illustrations of the key notes. As an homage to its prominent peppermint aroma, pair it with this candy cane-inspired set we found from Anthropologie.
Notes: Eucalyptus, peppermint, and bush lavender

Capri Blue Volcano Room Spray

Speaking of, if you’ve ever walked into an Anthropologie, you’re well aware of the best-selling scent from Capri Blue. In room spray form, it’s just as intoxicating and sweet, and the bold blue and silver bottle is the ultimate accent for a coastal-inspired nightstand. We’d play up the striking bottle with this cobalt blue-trimmed Rebecca Udall bedding that’s simple but beautiful.

Notes: Sugared citrus and tropical fruits

thisworks Deep Sleep Pillow Spray

Another Amazon favorite, this best-selling pillow spray employs stress-relieving, relaxing ingredients to help you sleep more soundly. If you need more support in that department, it’s one part of a collection of better sleep solutions. We think it’d be the perfect way to ensure any overnight guest gets a full eight hours. Pair it with this energetic floral print from Schoolhouse to create a home away from home they may never want to leave.

Notes: Lavender, chamomile, and vetiver

Maison Francis Kurkdjian Aqua Universalis Linen Mist

From the makers of the celeb-favorite Baccarat Rouge, this spray's olfactory palette consists of leathery musk juxtaposed with floral and citrus. For a scent Lee likened to “checking into a five-star hotel or shopping at a luxury boutique,” we’d choose these hotel-quality Frette sheets.

Notes: Musk, bergamot, bouquet of fresh white flowers, and lemon

Byredo Toile Textile Perfume

“I wasn't familiar with the Toile fragrance line prior to testing this product, but to me it smells soft and powdery,” says commerce director Rachel Fletcher. She noticed the aroma was “much more subtle” after it’s fully settled into the fabric with “a bit of floral that embodies an expensive hotel scent more than anything else.” She recommended misting it over this Piglet in a Bed gingham set for a night’s rest that feels as good as gold.

Notes: Bergamot, aldehyde, lily of the valley, violet silk, cotton musk
